Description: The Seven Sorrows of the Virgin; copy after Sebald Beham. Mary standing at the centre, slightly turned to the right, her arms crossed on her chest which is being pierced by a sword. Around her depictions of the seven sorrows framed by circular clouds. These are, on the left from bottom to top: the Presentation in the Temple, the Flight into Egypt; Christ amongst the Doctors. Above the Virgin: the Road to Calvary. On the right from top to bottom: the Crucifixion, the Descent from the Cross and the Entombment. Woodcut
Curator's comments: This woodcut was identified as a copy of 1925,0406.119 in Hollstein, although it is not clear which design was printed first.
Bibliographic references: Pauli 1901-11 / Hans Sebald Beham: Ein Kritisches Verzeichniss seiner Kupferstiche Radirungen und Holzschnitte (undescribed)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (888) (Beta, copy)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Evangelist
Representation of: St Simon of Cyrene
Representation of: St Joseph of Arimathaea
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Adalbert von Lanna (Sale, Stuttgart, Gutekunst, 12.v.1909/372)
